welcome.title: Welcome to Lines
welcome.subtitle: A tool for working with the Book of Changes. For moments when you need distance.

about.title: What is the Book of Changes?
about.body:
The Book of Changes, also known as the I Ching, is an ancient Chinese system of symbols.

It works with 64 hexagrams that describe different forms of change and development within a situation.

It does not predict what will happen. It helps you see the situation more clearly.

It is not an esoteric device, but a psychological tool for reflection.

hexagram.title: What is a hexagram?
hexagram.body:
A hexagram is a figure composed of six lines. Each line is either broken (yin) or unbroken (yang).

A hexagram consists of a lower and an upper trigram (three lines each).

Hexagrams are read from the bottom upward.

howTo.title: How does it work?
howTo.step1: Begin with a question that is relevant to you.
howTo.step2: The app generates a hexagram using virtual coin tosses, describing the dynamics of your situation.
howTo.step3: Read the interpretation as a prompt for reflection, not as a fixed conclusion.

changingLines.title: Changing lines
changingLines.body:
Sometimes a changing line appears during generation. It marks a point where the situation is developing.

In such cases, a second hexagram is generated, symbolizing the potential direction of change.
